title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: shiny app builder provides way combine different ohdsi shiny modules single app. example, characterization study, cohort method study prediction study related use cohorts, may want view results single shiny app. can done using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder combine characterization, cohort method prediction shiny modules OhdsiShinyModules. main source shiny modules OhdsiShinyModules R package, however, possible add modules R packages use local functions. vignette provide examples use OhdsiShinyAppBuilder create flexible shiny apps exploring OHDSI results. OhdsiShinyAppBuilder requires results explored shiny app saved single database (.e., results different shiny modules app saved result database), single database connection shared across shiny modules.

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: create shiny app config contains four shiny modules: (introduction shiny app) Cohort Generation (details generated cohorts) Estimation (details causal inference studies via cohort method) Prediction (details patient level prediction models) available shiny modules OhdsiShinyModules.

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: create shiny app via OhdsiShinyAppBuilder first need create config specification shiny modules wish include single shiny app. config can created using createModuleConfig. Note: possible add shiny modules R package setting shinyModulePackage R package UI server functions specifying UI function moduleUiFunction server function moduleServerFunction. wish use local functions UI server, set shinyModulePackage NULL. However, server function must take input id (module id standard shiny server modules) resultDatabaseSettings (list containing database result details required extracting results database can created using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder::createDefaultResultDatabaseSettings).

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: module specify config use shiny modules OhdsiShinyModules. UI named aboutViewer, server named aboutServer helper function called aboutHelperFile(). module provides information shiny app, ‘info’ icon seems appropriate. inputs createModuleConfig module : simplicity, OhdsiShinyAppBuilder contains function called createDefaultAboutConfig default settings createModuleConfig, quicker use createModuleConfig using standard module. Alternatively, just run:
code: aboutModule <- createModuleConfig(       moduleId = 'about',       tabName = "About",       shinyModulePackage = "OhdsiShinyModules",       moduleUiFunction = 'aboutViewer',       moduleServerFunction = 'aboutServer',       moduleInfoBoxFile =  "aboutHelperFile()",       moduleIcon = 'info',       installSource = 'github',       gitHubRepo = 'ohdsi'     ) aboutModule <- createDefaultAboutConfig()

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: add prediction module can specify OhdsiShinyModule functions: aboutPrediction module UI, aboutPrediction module server aboutPredictionFile() helper function. suitable icon chart-line. prediction module, results database format created PatientLevelPrediction package must database connected viewing shiny app. simplicity, OhdsiShinyAppBuilder contains function called createDefaultPredictionConfig default prediction settings. Atlernatively, just run:
code: predictionModule <- createModuleConfig(     moduleId = 'prediction',     tabName = "Prediction",     shinyModulePackage = 'OhdsiShinyModules',     moduleUiFunction = "predictionViewer",     moduleServerFunction = "predictionServer",     moduleInfoBoxFile =  "predictionHelperFile()",     moduleIcon = "chart-line",     installSource = 'github',     gitHubRepo = 'ohdsi'     ) predictionModule <- createDefaultPredictionConfig()

what: Creating the cohort generation and cohort method using default functions
title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: default config creation cohort method cohort generation using UI server functions found OhdsiShinyAppBuilder:

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: Next step combine module config settings shiny app config. First use initializeModuleConfig() create empty shiny app config use addModuleConfig() add module configs previously created: possible save shiny app config using saveConfig(shinyAppConfig, 'save location') load previously saved shiny app config shinyAppConfig <- loadConfig('save location')
code: library(dplyr) shinyAppConfig <- initializeModuleConfig() %>%   addModuleConfig(aboutModule) %>%   addModuleConfig(cohortGeneratorModule) %>%   addModuleConfig(cohortMethodModule) %>%   addModuleConfig(predictionModule)

what: Create an app.R for a shiny server
title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: create shiny app need first create shinyAppConfig, specify connectionDetails results stored finally can call createShinyApp. run shiny app shiny server need create app.R file config connection correctly specified. example, app.R contain following lines code: Note: specify package dependency via ‘shinyModulePackage’ value config previously installed, asked whether want install required package run createShinyApp viewShiny.
code: # save this as app.R and upload it to a shiny server  # create the config using existing UI and server functions  # in OhdsiShinyModules or by creating the UI and server functions fooModuleUi <- function (id = "foo") {     shiny::fluidPage(title = "foo")   }    fooModule <- function(   id = 'foo',   connectionHandler = NULL,   resultDatabaseSettings = NULL,   config   ) {   shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) { }) }    fooHelpInfo <- function() {   'NA' }    moduleConfig <- createModuleConfig(   moduleId = 'foo',   tabName = "foo",   shinyModulePackage = NULL,   moduleUiFunction = fooModuleUi,   moduleServerFunction = fooModule,   moduleInfoBoxFile = "fooHelpInfo()",   moduleIcon = "info" )    shinyAppConfig <- initializeModuleConfig() shinyAppConfig <- addModuleConfig(shinyAppConfig, moduleConfig)    # create a connection to the result database # in this example it is an empty sql database connectionDetails <- DatabaseConnector::createConnectionDetails(   dbms = 'sqlite',    server = './madeup.sql'   ) # Create the app createShinyApp(   config = shinyAppConfig,    connectionDetails = connectionDetails,    resultDatabaseSettings = createDefaultResultDatabaseSettings()     )

title: Using OhdsiShinyAppBuilder
text: just view shiny app locally, need specify config connection details result database run following lines code R: can specify title app short description study via inputs title studyDescription viewShiny createShinyApp functions.
code: # create the config using existing UI and server functions  # in OhdsiShinyModules or by creating the UI and server functions fooModuleUi <- function (id = "foo") {     shiny::fluidPage(title = "foo")   }    fooModule <- function(   id = 'foo',   connectionHandler = NULL,   resultDatabaseSettings = NULL,   config   ) {   shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) { }) }    fooHelpInfo <- function() {   file.path(tempdir(), 'help.html') }    moduleConfig <- createModuleConfig(   moduleId = 'foo',   tabName = "foo",   shinyModulePackage = NULL,   moduleUiFunction = fooModuleUi,   moduleServerFunction = fooModule,   moduleInfoBoxFile = "fooHelpInfo()",   moduleIcon = "info" )    shinyAppConfig <- initializeModuleConfig() shinyAppConfig <- addModuleConfig(shinyAppConfig, moduleConfig)    # create a connection to the result database # in this example it is an empty sql database connectionDetails <- DatabaseConnector::createConnectionDetails(   dbms = 'sqlite',    server = './madeup.sql'   )  # specify the app title appTitle <- 'Example Foo App'  # provide a short paragraph to described the study # that the is exploring the results of. studyDescription <- "An empty made up study for the vignette demo.  The shiny app with show one menu option called 'foo' that will not do anything."  # specify whether you want to use a pooled connection usePooledConnection <- F  # open a shiny app that lets you explore results viewShiny(   config = shinyAppConfig,    connectionDetails = connectionDetails,    resultDatabaseSettings = createDefaultResultDatabaseSettings(),    title = appTitle,    usePooledConnection = usePooledConnection,    studyDescription = studyDescription     )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Reps J, Hall N, Ide J, Gibert J (2025). OhdsiShinyAppBuilder: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences Informatics Results via 'shiny' Modules. R package version 1.0.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OhdsiShinyAppBuilder: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics Results via 'shiny' Modules},   author = {Jenna Reps and Nathan Hall and Josh Ide and Jamie Gibert},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

what: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics Results via shiny Modules
title: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics Results via shiny Modules
text: OhdsiShinyAppBuilder part HADES.

title: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics Results via shiny Modules
text: Create shiny apps using modules OhdsiShinyModules custom modules

title: Viewing Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics Results via shiny Modules
text: create shiny viewer explore CohortDiagnostic results, Characterization results, PatientLevelPrediction results CohortMethod results: connection works results database, interactive shiny app open.
code: # install dependencies remotes::install_github('ohdsi/ResultModelManager') remotes::install_github('ohdsi/OhdsiShinyAppBuilder')  library(dplyr) library(OhdsiShinyAppBuilder)  # STEP 1: create a config by first creating an empty config initializeModuleConfig() #         and then adding a shiny module using addModuleConfig()  # Note: the common OHDSI analyses have default config settings (e.g., createDefaultAboutConfig() )  config <- initializeModuleConfig() %>%   addModuleConfig(     createDefaultAboutConfig()   )  %>%   addModuleConfig(     createDefaultCohortDiagnosticsConfig()   ) %>%   addModuleConfig(     createDefaultCharacterizationConfig()   ) %>%   addModuleConfig(     createDefaultPredictionConfig()   ) %>%   addModuleConfig(     createDefaultEstimationConfig()   )  # Step 2: specify the connection details to the results database  #          using DatabaseConnector::createConnectionDetails  connectionDetails <- DatabaseConnector::createConnectionDetails(  # add details to the result database )  # Step 3: create a connection handler using the ResultModelManager package connection <- ResultModelManager::ConnectionHandler$new(connectionDetails)  # Step 4: now run the shiny app based on the config file and view the results #         at the specified connection OhdsiShinyAppBuilder::viewShiny( config = config,  connection = connection )  # Note - if you have non-standard table prefixes you may need  #   to specify them in createDefaultResultDatabaseSettings() OhdsiShinyAppBuilder::viewShiny( config = config,  connection = connection,   resultDatabaseSettings = createDefaultResultDatabaseSettings() )
